name: Birmingham, Rob
notes: No reliable public biographical information found uniquely identifying Rob Birmingham as a Bohemian Grove Totem In/Jinks Band member. Multiple professionals named Rob/Robert Birmingham exist in California (real estate, finance, technology), but none confirmed as this individual.

name: Bogardus, Andrew L
title: Executive Director, Net Lease Group (Capital Markets)
notes: Andrew L. Bogardus is an Executive Director at Cushman & Wakefield in San Francisco, specializing in net-leased property investment sales and sale-leaseback transactions since 1994. Licensed California real estate broker (Lic #00913825). Holds a Business Administration degree from the University of Colorado, Boulder. Member of NAIOP, ICSC, and the Belden Club.

name: Chiodo, Gino C.
notes: No reliable public biographical information found uniquely identifying Gino C. Chiodo as a Bohemian Grove Totem In/Jinks Band member. A Gino Chiodo in Pennsylvania owns Izzazu Salon and Ruby's WineHouse, but no California connection confirmed.

name: Chiodo, Mario Anthony
title: Founder and Lead Sculptor
notes: Mario Chiodo (born 1961, Oakland, CA) is a sculptor born into an Italian immigrant family. Born with tritanopia (a rare form of color blindness), he worked for over 40 years in sculptural design, beginning in the Halloween industry with licensing from LucasFilm, Disney, Paramount, and Universal Studios. He is best known for the 'Remember Them: Champions for Humanity' 25-foot, 60,000-pound bronze monument at Kaiser Memorial Park in downtown Oakland honoring Frederick Douglass, Cesar Chavez, Harvey Milk, Rosa Parks, and Ruby Bridges. Studio located at 934 Enterprise Way, Napa, CA.

name: Day, Douglas W.
notes: No reliable public biographical information found uniquely identifying Douglas W. Day as a Bohemian Grove Totem In/Jinks Band member.

name: Dehlinger, Robert J.
notes: No reliable public biographical information found uniquely identifying Robert J. Dehlinger as a Bohemian Grove Totem In/Jinks Band member. Dehlinger Winery (Sebastopol, Russian River Valley) is a Sonoma County winery founded by Tom Dehlinger, now run by daughters Eva and Carmen Dehlinger. A Rob Dehlinger (musician, Bay Area) is a possibility but identity unconfirmed.

name: Fisher, Robert M. Jr.
notes: No reliable public biographical information found uniquely identifying Robert M. Fisher Jr. as a Bohemian Grove Totem In/Jinks Band member. Robert J. Fisher is chairman of Gap Inc. and a managing director at Pisces Inc. (not Robert M. Fisher Jr.).

name: Forward, Robert H. Jr.
title: Attorney (Land Use, Entertainment, International Business)
notes: Robert H. Forward Jr. (California State Bar #45167, admitted 1970) is a Los Angeles attorney specializing in Land Use, Entertainment, and International Business Transactions. He practices at 2049 Century Park East, Suite 2100, Los Angeles, CA 90067.

name: Fratt, William H. E.
title: Founder and Managing Principal
notes: William H. E. ('Will') Fratt is Founder and Managing Principal of Auberge Capital Management, an investment firm based in Atherton, CA (registered at 10 Maple Avenue, Atherton, CA 94027). He has been in the role since May 2015. Prior experience includes Sift Security (acquired by Netskope in 2018) and Cascade Capital Management. He brings expertise in alternative investments, private equity, and business strategy.

name: Griesedieck, Joseph E. Jr.
title: Vice Chairman, Board & CEO Advisory Services
ngos: Jobs for America's Graduates (board member, 1996-2018); American Mural Project (board member)
notes: Joseph E. Griesedieck Jr. is Vice Chairman and Managing Director of Board & CEO Advisory Services at Korn Ferry, based in the San Francisco office. He has nearly 40 years in the executive search profession. He joined Russell Reynolds Associates in 1979, served as Managing Director at Spencer Stuart (CEO, 1985-2004), then joined Korn Ferry in 2004. Earlier career included VP at Alexander & Baldwin, Inc. and President/COO of Falstaff Brewing Corporation (where he served as a NYSE company director). Honored by Marquis Who's Who for corporate leadership expertise.

name: Harris, Jerrold B.
title: Retired CEO (VWR Corporation); Independent Director (BlackRock Capital Investment Corp.)
notes: Jerrold B. Harris (born June 6, 1942, San Francisco, CA) attended UC Berkeley (1959-1963). He rose through VWR Scientific's ranks from salesman (1964) to division president (1983-1986), then became COO (1987-1988) and CEO of VWR Corporation (Philadelphia, from 1989). He served as a director of BlackRock Capital Investment Corporation. Member of the Merion Golf Club and Olympic Golf Club. His son, Jerrold B. Harris Jr. ('Jay Jr.'), is also a Bohemian Grove member in this camp.

name: Harris, Jerrold B. (Jay) Jr.
notes: Jerrold B. Harris Jr. ('Jay Jr.') is the son of Jerrold B. Harris Sr. (VWR Corporation CEO). No independent professional biographical information found for Jerrold B. Harris Jr.

name: Hennessy, Neil J.
title: Chairman of the Board, President and CEO; Chief Market Strategist and Portfolio Manager
notes: Neil J. Hennessy founded Hennessy Advisors, Inc. in 1989 (as a broker/dealer) and launched the first Hennessy mutual fund in 1996. Hennessy Advisors is publicly traded on NASDAQ (HNNA), headquartered in Novato, California. He began his securities career in 1979 and previously worked at Paine Webber and Hambrecht & Quist. He holds a BBA from University of San Diego and a BS from University of San Francisco.

name: Hubbard, G. Scott
employer: Stanford University, Department of Aeronautics and Astronautics
title: Professor Emeritus (Consulting); Institute Strategist, B612 Asteroid Institute
ngos: B612 Foundation / Asteroid Institute (Institute Strategist); California Council on Science and Technology (CCST, distinguished expert); SpaceX Commercial Crew Safety Advisory Panel (chair, 2012-2023); Planetary Society
notes: G. Scott Hubbard (born December 27, 1948, Lexington, KY) served as the ninth Director of NASA Ames Research Center (2002-2006) and was the sole NASA representative on the Columbia Accident Investigation Board (2003). He was the first NASA Mars Exploration Program Director ('Mars Czar') and founder of NASA's Astrobiology Institute. He joined Stanford University's Aeronautics and Astronautics department after NASA, founding the Center of Excellence for Commercial Space Transportation and the journal New Space. Holds a BS in Physics/Astronomy from Vanderbilt University, graduate degrees from UC Berkeley, and an honorary Sc.D. from the Technical University of Madrid (2006). Has received eight NASA medals including the Distinguished Service Medal. Author of 'Exploring Mars: Chronicles from a Decade of Discovery.'

name: Jackson, Palmer G. Jr.
employer: Ann Jackson Family Foundation; Granada Theatre, Santa Barbara
title: Managing Trustee; Executive Chairman
ngos: Ann Jackson Family Foundation (Managing Trustee, since 2013); Granada Theatre, Santa Barbara (Executive Chairman); Santa Barbara Symphony (board member); Santa Barbara Museum of Natural History (Life Trustee, chair 2011-2013); Lobero Theater Foundation (former chairman); Santa Barbara Foundation Roundtable (board, chair 2018-2020); Mystic Ocean Adventures (board trustee, 2025)
notes: Palmer G. Jackson Jr. is a fourth-generation Santa Barbara native, graduate of Yale University and UC Berkeley Haas School of Business. He spent his career in consumer marketing, high technology, and nonprofit management. He helped co-found American Riviera Bank in 2005 (board director until 2009). The Ann Jackson Family Foundation distributes over $3.5 million annually to Santa Barbara nonprofits. He is also a lifelong musician and plays with The Doublewide Kings.

name: Kennedy, George L.
notes: No reliable public biographical information found uniquely identifying George L. Kennedy as a Bohemian Grove Totem In/Jinks Band member. The prominent George W. Kennedy was District Attorney of Santa Clara County (1990-2007), but his middle initial is W, not L.

name: Klein, James D.
notes: No reliable public biographical information found uniquely identifying James D. Klein as a Bohemian Grove Totem In/Jinks Band member. Multiple executives and attorneys named James Klein exist in California.

name: Knudsen, Derek T.
employer: Law Office of Derek T. Knudsen (Knudsen & Weiss, A Partnership of Professional Corporations)
title: Attorney; Former Assistant Professor of Law
notes: Derek Thomas Knudsen (born September 5, 1943, Oakland, CA) is a California attorney (State Bar #45450, admitted 1970) specializing in federal taxation, estate planning, probate, real property, and general business law in San Francisco. He served as Assistant Professor of Law teaching Tax and Estate Planning at UC Hastings College of Law. He is a Certified Specialist in Taxation Law with the State Bar of California Board of Legal Specialization. He practices at 425 California Street, San Francisco.

name: Lanctot, Lawrence R.
title: Partner
notes: Lawrence Robert Lanctot (California State Bar #44003) is a partner at Watson & Lanctot LLP, 44 Montgomery Street, Suite 3585, San Francisco, CA. He holds a BA from University of Santa Clara (1965), a JD from University of San Francisco (1968), and an LLM from Columbia University (1969). He began his career at Pillsbury Madison & Sutro. He practices estate planning, trust administration, probate, real property law, and international law. He has been licensed for over 57 years. Member of the American Bar Association (International Law and Estate Planning sections) and State Bar of California (Business Law and Real Property sections).

name: Lind, Stephen A.
employer: UC Law San Francisco (formerly UC Hastings College of the Law)
title: Emeritus Professor of Law (Tax)
notes: Stephen A. Lind (January 15, 1941 - February 15, 2024) was an Emeritus Professor of Law at UC Law SF (formerly UC Hastings), where he taught from 1975. He held a BA and JD from UC Berkeley and an LLM in Taxation from NYU (1966). He co-authored leading law school casebooks including 'The Fundamentals of Federal Income Taxation' (14th ed.) and 'Federal Estate and Gift Taxation' (8th ed.), used by students nationwide for over 50 years. The University of Florida established the 'Stephen A. Lind Eminent Scholar Chair in Federal Taxation' in his honor. He passed away in February 2024.

name: McEachron, Brian L.
title: Senior Corporate Attorney, Worldwide Sales and Support Group (former)
notes: Brian L. McEachron was Senior Corporate Attorney in the Worldwide Sales and Support Group at Microsoft Corporation, responsible for legal affairs in Canada, Latin America, the Middle East, and Africa, including IP protection and commercial transactions. He testified before the U.S. Trade Deficit Review Commission in Palo Alto, CA (November 1999) on behalf of Microsoft and the Business Software Alliance (BSA), of which he was a Vice President. He received his undergraduate degree from Dartmouth College (1976) and his JD from UC Hastings College of the Law. Prior to joining Microsoft in 1988, he practiced law in San Francisco and Seattle.

name: Miller, Anthony T.
notes: No reliable public biographical information found uniquely identifying Anthony T. Miller as a Bohemian Grove Totem In/Jinks Band member.

name: Osborne, Brent W.
title: President
notes: Brent W. Osborne is President of Jazz On FM, a radio broadcasting company, based in Burlingame, California. He has spent over 40 years in broadcast sales and management primarily on the radio side. His skills include strategic planning, contract negotiation, budgets, fundraising, and start-up operations.

name: Pollock, Jeffrey Ord
title: Vice President / Founder
notes: Jeffrey Ord Pollock is associated with Pollock Financial Group, a Portola Valley, California financial services firm in operation since 1960 (150 Portola Road, Portola Valley, CA 94028). He was also associated with Broadstreet Family Office / Innovative Financial Outsourcing, a family office services firm. He has a FINRA BrokerCheck individual registration (#1401806). He has been involved in commercial real estate development projects in the Palo Alto area. He resides in Redwood City, CA.

name: Robinson, Ted
title: Play-by-Play Broadcaster
ngos: Positive Coaching Alliance (National Advisory Board member); TeachAids (advisor)
notes: Ted Robinson (born July 19, 1957, Rockville Centre, NY) is a veteran sports broadcaster who has been with NBC Sports since 2000. A 1978 University of Notre Dame graduate, he relocated to California in the early 1980s, anchoring sports at KCBS radio (1982) and broadcasting Oakland Athletics games (1980). He served as radio play-by-play announcer for the San Francisco 49ers (2009-2018) and has broadcast the US Open tennis tournament for 22 years. He won a Sports Emmy as part of NBCUniversal's 2024 Paris Olympics coverage. He lives in Atherton, CA. He is also a member of the Northern California Jewish Sports Hall of Fame.

name: Roosevelt, Michael A.
title: Partner, Estate Planning and Probate Attorney
notes: Michael Anthony Roosevelt (California State Bar #56049, admitted 1973) is a San Francisco estate planning and probate attorney at Friedman McCubbin Law Group LLP, 425 California Street, 25th Floor, San Francisco. He graduated from Harvard University (BA, 1969) and Columbia Law School (JD, 1972). He has been recognized by Super Lawyers repeatedly (2004-2006, 2008-2022) and holds a Martindale-Hubbell AV Preeminent peer rating. He is likely a descendant of the Theodore Roosevelt family (the research brief notes him as a great-grandson of President Theodore Roosevelt).

name: Ryland, Kyle
title: Managing Partner and Founding Partner; Chair of the Investment Committee
notes: Kyle Ryland is Managing Partner of Sumeru Equity Partners, a technology-focused private equity firm based in San Mateo, CA that was spun out of Silver Lake. He co-founded and served as Managing Director of Silver Lake Sumeru before founding Sumeru independently. Previously he was a Managing Director and Head of Global Technology Investment Banking at Lehman Brothers, a Partner at Shah Capital Partners, and a technology investment banker at Robertson Stephens. He holds a BA in Political Science and Public Policy from Duke University (where he serves on the Board of Visitors of Trinity College) and an MBA from the Wharton School, University of Pennsylvania.

name: Settlemier, B. Reid
employer: Bigge Crane and Rigging Co.; Redwood Property Investors LLC
title: Director / Vice President (Bigge); Managing Director and Co-Owner (Redwood Property Investors)
notes: B. Reid Settlemier is Vice President of Bigge Crane and Rigging Company (San Leandro, CA) and co-owner of Redwood Property Investors LLC (Oakland, CA). In 2004, his father Brock R. Settlemier (CEO, The Bigge Group) sold the Bigge Group — comprising Bigge Crane and Rigging Company, Crane Certification Company, Bigge Development Company (San Leandro), and Shaughnessy Heavy Industries (Auburn, WA) — to Reid and his brother Weston. Reid has been active in the business since 1991. He also runs Bigge Equipment Company (Terex, Tadano, Liebherr dealerships). He holds a BS in Business Administration from the University of Colorado Boulder.

name: Stegall, A. John III
title: Managing Member (formerly)
notes: A. John Stegall III is associated with AJS Land, LLC, a real estate land entity in Santa Barbara, California. Limited additional public biographical information is publicly available.

name: Vap, J. Gordon
notes: No reliable public biographical information found uniquely identifying J. Gordon Vap as a Bohemian Grove Totem In/Jinks Band member. A James Gordon Vap, MD (UC Davis School of Medicine, 1972) practices otolaryngology in Washington, DC area. A 'Gordie Vap' is a Managing Director at William Blair in Charlotte, NC. Neither identity is confirmed.

name: Walton, Rob
notes: No reliable public biographical information found uniquely identifying Rob Walton as a Bohemian Grove Totem In/Jinks Band member. This is not confirmed to be S. Robson Walton (former Walmart chairman), who would likely be associated with a more prominent camp. Multiple professionals named Rob Walton exist.
